title: Fix admin Access Denied login navigation and clarify default admin username

requirements.summary: Make the AdminLayoutPage “Access Denied” Back to Login action always route to /admin/login and reliably show the admin login form, even after deep-links/refreshes.
acceptanceCriteria: When an unauthorized user hits the AdminLayoutPage “Access Denied” state, clicking “Back to Login” navigates to `/admin/login` and renders the AdminLoginPage form.
Navigation works reliably (no no-op click) across refreshes and direct deep-links into `/admin/*` routes.

file_operations.description: Update the “Access Denied” UI so “Back to Login” reliably navigates to `/admin/login` by clearing any stored admin session token before navigation (preventing immediate redirect loops), and ensure the navigation is handled in a way that works consistently across deep-links/refreshes.

Adjust the admin login page behavior so visiting `/admin/login` always renders the login form (avoid auto-redirecting away solely due to a cached token), ensuring the Access Denied -> Back to Login flow is never a no-op.

requirements.summary: Clearly communicate the admin login route and default admin username (admin) in the Admin login UI and frontend documentation.
acceptanceCriteria: The Admin login UI displays the default username as `admin` (and does not contradict it elsewhere in the UI).
The frontend documentation (frontend/README.md) explicitly states: admin login URL `/admin/login` and default admin username `admin` (in English).

file_operations.description: Update the Admin login UI helper text to explicitly state the default admin username is `admin` (English user-facing text) and remove/adjust any credential hints that could contradict the requirement.
Add/update an Admin Access section explicitly documenting the admin login URL `/admin/login` and default admin username `admin` in English, ensuring it is not contradicted elsewhere in the README.
